p.span:
It is easier than ever to apply for free or reduced lunch meals.
To apply online, click the EZ Meal App button below.

span.style: text-align: center; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span:
If you prefer to submit a paper application for free and reduced-price meals, you can download one below.
Paper applications are also available at school offices, the District office, and the Child Nutrition office.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: arial; font-size: 13.3333px; text-align: center;
p.span: Completed paper applications can be mailed or hand-delivered to the Child Nutrition office.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: arial; font-size: 13.3333px; text-align: center;

a.title: Paper Application for Free and Reduced-Price Meals

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: As a service to you and your child, your school has joined with 1,000s of others by offering you access to a low cost, voluntary purchase student accident/sickness insurance program. The program is sponsored by the California School Boards Association.

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;
height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: The Special Education Local Plan Area is responsible for assuring program availability for all students with disabilities by assisting districts with program development and coordinating regional programs within area. Also provides training for parents.

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;
height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Resources that support families: food, clothing, employment, a free or low-cost health clinic, training, free eyeglasses replacement for the elderly, affordable parenting classes or other counseling.

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;
height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Directory of homeless shelters within the cities of San Bernardino County.

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;
height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: A program that gives cash aid and services to eligible California families. The program serves all the counties in the state and is operated locally by county welfare departments.

td.style: height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;
height: 15pt; width: 316pt; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Covered California and the Department of Health Serviceswork together to support health insurance shoppers to get the coverage and care that’s right for Californians.

p.span: Please watch this 4 minute video on teen suicide prevention:

strong.span: Counseling services are available for Etiwanda School District students at each of our school sites. To inquire about counseling services please call or visit your child’s school office.

a.title: “Save a Friend: Tips for Teens to Prevent Suicide”

strong.a: “Save a Friend: Tips for Teens to Prevent Suicide”

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Links and information from the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) to assist in the prevention of teen suicide. The NASP is the major national professional organization for school psychologists in the United States. They represent and support school psychology through leadership to enhance the mental health and educational competence of all children.

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

a.title: Alliance of Hope for Suicide Loss Survivors

strong.a: Alliance of Hope for Suicide Loss Survivors

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Alliance of Hope is an online resource for people that have lost a loved one to suicide. It is a place for healing and remembrance.

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

a.title: Parents of Suicides - Family and Friends of Suicides

strong.a: Parents of Suicides - Family and Friends of Suicides

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: An online community filled with resources for people dealing with suicide.

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

strong.a: National Alliance on Mental Illness

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: A confidential information and referral helpline to assist those navigating the path to recovery for themselves or a loved one.

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

strong.a: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: The Lifeline provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones, and best practices for professionals.

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

strong.a: Seeking Safety Connections

td.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;

tr.td: Listing of agencies available to assist those in need. Dial 211 to be directed to any resource for immediate assistance. Dial 911 for any emergency situation.

tr.td: A free service for setting time-based restrictions on smart phones and mobile devices. Parents can install it on a child's device, and control the settings to set device bedtimes, schedules, and block or grant access to apps at a moment's notice.

ul.li: Video that shows parents how to sign up for weekly email updates for grades from Aeries.

div.h4: How Students can Access Online Programs from Home

span.style: font-size: 28px; font-family: "MS Sans Serif"; color: rgb(29, 27, 16);
font-family: "MS Sans Serif"; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: To access school programs from home, try signing on your student to the Chrome Browser.

span.style: font-size: medium; -webkit-text-stroke-color: initial; font-family: "MS Sans Serif"; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: When your student signs in to the Chrome browser with their Etiwanda SD account, the student can easily log in to school apps / programs (including their Google Apps) on any device.

span.style: font-size: medium; -webkit-text-stroke-color: initial; font-family: "MS Sans Serif"; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

p.span: Remember only sign into Chrome from trusted devices, and NOT a public computer.

span.style: font-size: x-large; -webkit-text-stroke-color: initial; font-family: "Google Sans", Roboto, sans-serif; color: rgb(32, 33, 36);
span.br: Sign on to the Chrome Browser

span.span: In the top right, click Profile

img.title: Profile
img.style: color: rgb(60, 64, 67); font-size: large; width: 30px; height: 30px; left: 250px; top: 796px;

span.span: Sign in with your student's Etiwanda Google Account username and password.

li.span: Having signed on to Chrome, select the Chrome Home button at the top left.
Select from the list of school online programs and Log in with Google or Clever.

br.span: If more than one account or persons share a computer with others, you may need to switch to another person or profile or add a new person in Chrome.

h2.style: color: rgb(32, 33, 36); font-family: "Google Sans", Roboto, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 2rem; margin: 2rem 0px 0.5rem;

span.span: At the top right, click Profile

li.span: Choose a name and a photo.
Click Save. A new window will open and ask you to turn on sync.

h2.span: Switch to another person or profile

span.span: At the top right, click Profile

li.span: Choose the person or profile you want to switch to.

div.p: The Etiwanda School District is dedicated to promoting high standards in curriculum, instruction, performance and personal behavior. It is our goal that each student achieve academic excellence and develop respect for self and others so that they become contributing members of our culturally diverse society. The responsibility for the development of these qualities in all students is accomplished through a cooperative effort among students, parents, staff and community.
